required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Epidural Neostigmine Dose Response for the Treatment of Labor Pain

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see which dose of epidural neostigmine is the best additive to use with the numbing medication used in an epidural during labor.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is examining the use of the non-narcotic medication, neostigmine, in combination with the local anesthetic bupivacaine when compared with the commonly used narcotic fentanyl in providing pain relief with the fewest side effects in labor analgesia.

primary_outcome.measure: Amount of Drug Consumed Per Hour in Each Group(Arm)
primary_outcome.description: Median hourly total bupivacaine consumption. Drug amount consumed per hour of each group (arm)

secondary_outcome.description: average maximum nausea score in each group--maternal nausea scored on a 0-no nausea at all up to maximum of 10-worst nausea imaginable
average maternal sedation score measured on a 0-not sleepy at all up to a maximum of 10-extremely sleepy
maternal occurrence of shivering--Shivering scored on a 0-no shivering at all up to maximum of 10-shivering uncontrollably
the occurrence of pruritis (itching) throughout the labor analgesia infusion--the presence of itching rated on a scale of 0-no itching at all up to a maximum of 10- severe itching.

the incidence of decreased motor block (Bromage score) documented until delivery. Bromage is defined as 0-freely able to move extremities (no motor block) up to 3-unable to move legs or feet (complete motor block)
maternal reported satisfaction scores of labor analgesia on a scale of 1-5, with 1-not satisfied at all up to 5 -completely satisfied with labor analgesia
percentage of subjects in each group requiring a ceserean delivery

arm_group.description: STUDY DRUG INFUSION WITH NEOSTIGMINE 8 MCG/ML
STUDY DRUG INFUSION CONC NEOSTIGMINE 4 MCG/ML
Bupivacaine with fentanyl 2 mcg/ml. STANDARD INFUSION

intervention.description: utilizing 3 different dosages of neostigmine and comparing it to the standard of fentanyl. Infusion runs via PCA throughout labor analgesia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy pregnancy
- Term pregnancy ( > 37 weeks)
- Primiparous or multiparous
- Induction or spontaneous labor greater or = 18 years of age
- Cervical exam on entry </=5 cm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Weight > 115 kg
- Non-English speaking
- IV analgesics within 60 minutes prior to epidural being administered
- Allergy to local anesthetics or neostigmine

overall_official.affiliation: Wake Forest University Health Sciences OB Anesthesia

clinical_study.keyword: Non narcotic treatment of labor pain

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
